title: Add support for USBMSD
body:
### Description

Update USBMSD from unsupported to match the new USB API. USBMSD now takes in a block device in its constructor. Because block devices cant be used for interrupt context, this change also adds code to allow deferral to threads by calling USBMSD::process(). Internally USBMSD uses a new experimental class, TaskQueue, to manage this deferral. Finally, this PR fixes a couple USB bugs which surfaced when USBMSD was added.

title: Corrected asynchronous DNS functionality
body:
### Description

Made fixes to asynchronous DNS. These are fixes to PR: https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/pull/6847

List of changes:
- Set network stack to store event queue so that mbed::mbed_event_queue() call
  is not needed every time call_in() is called
- Added dns state variables and enum (states are: created, initiated and cancelled)
- Corrected DNS response handling so that if DNS server returns that host name is
  unknown the DNS query is not tried again
- Reorder mutexes in nsapi_dns_query_multiple_async()
- Created nsapi_dns_query_async_initiate_next() function to initiate the next
  DNS query from the queue after delete of previous query
- Added dsn_timer_running variable to supervise DNS timer start/stop
- Changed cancel function to only mark query as deleted and moved deletion
  to timer function. This allows to run socket close on DNS thread
- Added new nsapi error NSAPI_ERROR_TIMEOUT for DNS (and other) timeouts

    [ ] New target

title: NRF52 linker script is incomplete for ARMCC and IAR
body:
### Description

The latest softdevice and nordic SDK have introduced a new way of registering event handlers: Event handlers are not registered in RAM at runtime, they are registered in flash at compile time. Unfortunately this mechanism requires some help from the linker script to group events handlers in specific program sections. This is correctly done in GCC linker script (see [here](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/master/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_NRF5x/TARGET_NRF52/TARGET_MCU_NRF52832/device/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_ARM/NRF52832.ld#L110-L143)) but not done at all with ARMCC or IAR linker scripts. As a result BLE doesn't work properly on those targets when an application is compiled with ARMCC or GCC.

This issue also applies for NRF52840 targets.

### Issue request type

[ ] Enhancement

title: EFM32: make mbed_rtx.h depend of families instead of targets
body:
### Description

Currently, custom targets based on these families would require a fork of mbed-os, otherwise the build would fail on an undefined `INITIAL_SP`:

- EFM32GG
- EFM32HG
- EFM32LG
- EFM32PG
- EFM32WG

This is due to specific targets like `EFM32GG_STK3700` being used in `mbed_rtx.h`, instead of families such as `EFM32GG`.

The newest families `EFR32MG12` and `EFM32PG12` do not have this issue. This PR aligns `mbed_rtx.h` with the approach of these new families.

body:
### Description
This PR tries to fix heap memory error with `ARM_LIB_STACK`/`ARM_LIB_HEAP` in RTOS-less code. Per our check, heap base/limit passed to `__rt_lib_init` are incorrect in the condition that `__user_setup_stackheap` and `ARM_LIB_STACK`/`ARM_LIB_HEAP` co-exist. Both `ARM`/`ARMC6` have the same issue.

The issue occurs only in RTOS-less, not in RTOS. This PR doesn't influence RTOS code.

title: EFM32 IRQ handling fix
body:
### Description

* IRQ handling got updated previously to a non-functional state when both callbacks were registered (it'd fire a fall callback for both rise and fall events). With this update, that faulty behaviour is corrected. Due to delays between the detection of the edge and the handling of the interrupt (and the fact that information about which edge you received on the pin is not stored anywhere), there is no way to be absolutely sure which edge got triggered on the pin. Therefore, we make a best-guess effort by looking at the pin state at the time of IRQ handling, and fire a callback as if that was the end state of the event. This will usually work out fine, except in cases were the signal is toggling faster than the IRQ handler's response time. In that case, a user won't get both callbacks (as expected for a pulse), but only the last event.
* Stripped some dead code.

This supersedes PR #6976 to avoid reverting back to code we know is faulty (does not detect short pulses). @DBS06

### Pull request type

    [X] Fix
    [ ] Refactor
    [ ] New target
    [ ] Feature
    [ ] Breaking change

title: Prioritize mbed_app.json instead of target_config.json when compiling tests
body:
### Description

Mbed OS contains a target_config.json file here:
https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/master/tools/test_configs/target_configs.json

When compiling tests for any of the platforms listed in this file (UBLOX_EVK_ODIN_W2, K64, REALTEK_RTL8195AM, NUCLEO_F429ZI), the build system goes and reads the target_config.json and ignores the mbed_app.json in my project.

This is an annoying and inconsistent behavior when comparing it with other platforms.

Steps to reproduce:
```
mbed import https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-stress-test
cd mbed-stress-test
mbed test --compile -m NUCLEO_F429ZI -t GCC_ARM
```

Workaround:
```
mbed test --compile -m NUCLEO_F429ZI -t GCC_ARM --app-config=mbed_app.json
```

Note, app-config is not needed when using other platforms.

Mbed CLI 1.5.1

### Issue request type
 [ ] Question
 [ ] Enhancement 
 [X] Bug

title: ppp_lwip_disconnect hangs on acquiring ppp_close_sem semaphore when cellular connection fails with NSAPI_ERROR_CONNECTION_LOST
body:
### Description
When using the OnboardCellularInterface to connect, it might be that the connection fails with reason NSAPI_ERROR_CONNECTION_LOST. If afterwards, disconnect() is called on the same interface, the thread will hang forever on https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/master/features/FEATURE_LWIP/lwip-interface/ppp_lwip.cpp#L302.

* Target: [custom target for STM32F205RG](https://github.com/withthegrid/mbed-os/tree/wtg-mbed-os/targets/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32F2/TARGET_STM32F205RG)
* Toolchain: GCC_ARM,  7.2.1 20170904
* Tools: 1.5.0
* Mbed OS SHA: we use a fork (https://github.com/withthegrid/mbed-os/commit/0fcddaac2156599df88725d904acbd4f7e39d004), which is regularly updated from the master branch (last on 2104d8a)

I've fixed this locally by only waiting for the semaphore if `ppp_active` is true, see https://github.com/withthegrid/mbed-os/commit/df65e7d9352d810d65123f9bb83e2e569e4ba07e. I'm not sure this quickfix hasn't any unexpected side-effects, which is why I'm opening an issue instead of a pull request.

Reproduction steps:
* initialize a OnboardCellularInterface
* ensure the antenna is connected and call `connect();`
* remove the antenna during connection, in such a way that NSAPI_ERROR_CONNECTION_LOST is returned
* call `disconnect();`

title: Exporter for CrossCore Embedded Studio is incorrectly handling the -mfloat-abi option
body:
### Description
Exporter for CrossCore Embedded Studio adds softfp option to additional options which causes a link failure.

Steps to reproduce:
pip install mbed-cli
mbed import mbed-os-example-blinky
cd mbed-os-example-blinky
mbed export -i cces -m EV_COG_AD4050LZ
Open CCES, import mbed-os-example-blinky/cces project.
Build
First build error is because `softfp` is not found.

The exporter is adding the `-mfloat-abi` option for all tools (including the linker) as below:

```
{% if float_abi %}
    "-mfloat-abi=${value}" : {
    "type" : "command",
    "value" : "{{ float_abi }}"
},
{% endif %}
```

but the linker float-abi option is handled as an enumerated type instead of a string, so the option above is adding as an additional option instead (and hence the build failure).

There is a secondary issue here with the -mfloat-abi option being added twice to the compiler command (once as an "additional option" and once as the -mfloat-abi option). The exporter should be removing the "additional option" and only using the -mfloat-abi option but this appears to have broken. The same is true for -mcpu, -mthumb and -mfpu.

### Issue request type
    [X ] Bug

title: STM32F7 Flash Dual Bank support
body:
### Description
<!-- 
    Required
    Add detailed description of what you are reporting.
    Good example: https://os.mbed.com/docs/latest/reference/workflow.html
    Things to consider sharing:
    - What target does this relate to?
    - What toolchain (name + version) are you using?
    - What tools (name + version - is it mbed-cli, online compiler or IDE) are you using?
    - What is the SHA of Mbed OS (git log -n1 --oneline)?
    - Steps to reproduce. (Did you publish code or a test case that exhibits the problem?)
-->

In order to support sensible SOTP and NV Store values, the STM32F7 platforms should have dual bank flash support.

At the moment this is not supported: https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/79640c6a885d2006d3cedff3f666f8c253818c27/targets/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32F7/flash_api.c#L109

**Impact:**
In order to support drag and drop programming of devices with Mbed Cloud Client, we need to set the SOTP regions to the end of the bank. This allows consistent device identity and the ability to use the RoT in the SOTP sector.

**Example:**
The NUCLEO_F746ZG platform has 1Mb of flash. The flash sectors at the end of the single bank are 256kb a piece (at 0x08080000 and 0x080C0000). Therefore SOTP is taking up more than half the available flash on the board. By enabling dual bank flash sectors, the end sectors would only be 128kb, thus taking up 25% rather than 50% of the available flash memory.

title: ticker test improvement
body:
### Description

Make multiticker test more reliable when scheduling very early interrupts.

When very early interrupt is scheduled (e.g now + 2[ticks]) then it's likely that it won't be fired in some circumstances and as a result there is overdue event in queue. That overdue event can be mistakenly scheduled again by `Ticker::detach` (detach calls schedule if head was removed). That's why we should check interrupts counter immediately after wait period and before detach loop

title: STM32 : script to generate PeripheralPins.c for new target addition
body:
### Description

Goal is to help users to add a new STM32 MCU in MBED.

One tricky point is to build PeripheralPins.c and PinNames.h files.

If you have installed STM32CubeMX tool from:
http://www.st.com/en/development-tools/stm32cubemx.html

we have implemented a script to build the 2 MBED files from the ST description files.

Wiki page will be updated after PR merge:
https://os.mbed.com/teams/ST/wiki/steps-to-create-a-new-STM32-platform


$ python STM32_gen_PeripheralPins.py -h
usage: STM32_gen_PeripheralPins.py [-h] [-l | -b | -m xml | -t HW]

Script will generate PeripheralPins.c thanks to the xml files description available in
STM32CubeMX directory defined in 'cube_path.json':
        C:\Program Files (x86)\STMicroelectronics\STM32Cube\STM32CubeMX\db

optional arguments:
  -h, --help          show this help message and exit
  -l, --list          list available mcu xml files description in STM32CubeMX
  -b, --boards        list available boards description in STM32CubeMX
  -m xml, --mcu xml   specify the mcu xml file description in STM32CubeMX to use (use double quotes).
                         Parameter can be a filter like L496 if you want to parse all L496 chips (-m STM32 to parse all).
  -t HW, --target HW  specify the board file description in STM32CubeMX to use (use double quotes).
                         Parameter can be a filter like L496 (only the first file found will be parsed).

Once generated, you have to check and comment pins that can not be used (specific HW, internal ADC channels, remove PWM using us ticker timer, ...)

body:
### Environment
**Target**
K64F

**mbed-os-example-blinky**
5.8.3

**mbed-os**
5.8.3

**ARM Toolchain**
5.24

**ARMC6 Toolchain**
6.10

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add `mbed_app.json` to enable MBED_HEAP_STATS_ENABLED
    ```
    {
        "target_overrides": {
            "K64F": {
                "target.macros_add": [
                    "MBED_HEAP_STATS_ENABLED=1",
                    "MBED_MEM_TRACING_ENABLED=1"
                ],
                "target.features_remove": ["LWIP"]
            }
        }
    }
    ```
1. Add `.mbedignore` for RTOS-less build
    ```
    mbed-os/rtos/*
    mbed-os/features/cellular/
    mbed-os/features/FEATURE_CLIENT/*
    mbed-os/features/FEATURE_COMMON_PAL/*
    mbed-os/features/FEATURE_UVISOR/*
    mbed-os/features/frameworks/*
    mbed-os/features/nanostack/*
    mbed-os/features/net/*
    mbed-os/features/netsocket/*
    mbed-os/features/nvstore/*
    mbed-os/features/storage/*
    mbed-os/events/*
    mbed-os/features/lorawan/*
    ```
1. Export to Keil project
1. Enter Keil project, compile it, and enter debug session
1. Before run, set breakpoint on the start of `malloc_wrapper`/`free_wrapper` in `mbed-os`/`platform`/`mbed_alloc_wrappers.cpp`.
1. Run the program, and you woud find `free_wrapper` is called before `malloc_wrapper` in C run-time initialization.

The memory hook mechanism relies on paired `malloc`/`free`, but it is broken here.

Target
SiliconLabs EFM32PG12_STK3402

PinNames.h defines the expansion header as:

    /* Expansion headers */
    EXP3  = PA8,
    EXP4  = PC6,
    EXP5  = PA9,
    EXP6  = PC7,
    EXP7  = PF3,
    EXP8  = PC8,
    EXP9  = PF4,
    EXP10 = PC9,
    EXP11 = PF5,
    EXP12 = PA6,
    EXP13 = PF6,
    EXP14 = PA7,
    EXP15 = PC11,
    EXP16 = PC10,

Yet this disagrees with the documentation which shows:

    EXP3  = PC9,
    EXP4  = PA6,
    EXP5  = PD9,
    EXP6  = PA7,
    EXP7  = PB6,
    EXP8  = PA8,
    EXP9  = PB7,
    EXP10 = PA9
    EXP11 = PB8,
    EXP12 = PD10,
    EXP13 = PD8,
    EXP14 = PD11
    EXP15 = PC11,
    EXP16 = PC10,

Please reference Figure 4.1 or Section 4.2 here: [STK3402 User Guide](https://www.silabs.com/documents/public/user-guides/ug257-stk3402-usersguide.pdf)

title: NRF52: Stall on SPI Master + RTC IRQs and compile fixes for non SOFTDEVICE_PRESENT target
body:
### Description

Contains a set of minor fixes to avoid a crash if IRQ of SPI master and RTC fire due to the sequence of IRQ locking.

The bug is reproducable with a certain binary (priv) and jumper.io, with real hardware this causes spurious hangs.

It also adds app_fifo./h from nordic SDK to make it build without SOFTDEVICE_PRESENT flag.

body:
### Description

In Nuvoton targets, `ARM`/`ARMC6` port, its memory model is two-region with `ARM_LIB_STACK`/`ARM_LIB_HEAP` sections defined. In RTOS build, `mbed-os-example-blinky` can run successfully as usual. But in RTOS-less build, it crashes in C run-time initialization. To re-produce the crash, I test with the environment:

5.8.3

**mbed-os**
5.8.3

**Target**
NUMAKER_PFM_NUC472
NUMAKER_PFM_M453
NUMAKER_PFM_M487
NUMAKER_PFM_NANO130

5.24

**ARMC6 Toolchain**
6.10

title: mbed-os/TESTS/netsocket/socket_sigio issue
body:
### inconsistent test failure
Failures when testing with socket_sigio running GreenTea netsocket test suit are being observed.  I have performed some preliminary investigatation and the problem is that the test routine 'get_data' is being called more than once and called after the socket has been closed.  From what I can see, the routine should be called once.
There are several EventQueues performing calls and it is possible the timing issues between them are causing failures.  It could also be possible that the tests that are stacked up back-to-back and one is trying to read a socket that another closed.  The ​Log data is:

I am able to make the test operate correctly by modifying the 'get_data' routine and putting the recvd.release() after the ASSERT test prior to the printf's effectively changing the timing as follows:

    TEST_ASSERT_EQUAL(result, true);
    // Signal that we have recvd
    recvd.release();
    printf("HTTP: Received %d chars from server\r\n", len);
    printf("HTTP: Received 200 OK status ... %s\r\n", found_200_ok ? "[OK]" : "[FAIL]");
    printf("HTTP: Received '%s' status ... %s\r\n", HTTP_HELLO_STR, found_hello ? "[OK]" : "[FAIL]");
    printf("HTTP: Received message:\r\n");
    printf("%s", buffer);
printf("JMF: done with get_data()\n");

so WRT the failure, it appears a timing issue exists in the test itself.   I don't understand the test sequence but it is not possible to read from a closed socket so timing is off somewhere.

This is occurring on a K64F running with an Avnet AT&T Started Kit IoT Shield.

title: #defines for git info
body:
### Description
This feature was requested several years ago [on the Mbed forum](https://os.mbed.com/forum/bugs-suggestions/topic/3161/).

It would be useful to be able to access project Git hash / commit metadata from source code, probably as `#define`s, e.g. to output to console.

Example: https://stackoverflow.com/a/12368262

The primary thing to have is the commit hash. "Dirty" bool and tags would be nice to have. NB: I'm requesting metadata for the **project**, not for Mbed OS.

Hopefully you could make it work for Mbed CLI and exported projects.

### Issue request type
[ ] Question  
[X] Enhancement  
[ ] Bug

title: gerentea test_env defines NL and RCNL
body:
[ ] Question  
[ ] Enhancement  
[ X] Bug  


```
/**
 *  Auxilary macros
 */
#define NL "\n"
#define RCNL "\r\n"
```
This can cause issues, since `NL` and `RCNL` are not uncommonly already defined in many projects.

title: NRF5x: redirect NRF logging to mbed stdout
body:
### Description

The Nordic SDK libraries have a significant amount of logging available that can be very useful during development and debugging. 
Unfortunately the provided logging engines expect the NRF5 SDK to be in direct control of the hardware which makes it unsuitable for most mbed use cases.

This PR replaces Nordic's logging backend/outputs with simple printf style log entries when the config entry `softdevice.nrf_enable_logging` is set to `1`

As such the logs will go to the standard serial stdout provided by mbed. 

This changeset was originally added in a slightly different form to #6860 but is complex enough to warrant its own PR

If/when #5965 is finished this nordic logging wrapper could be extended to take advantage of the log configuration / levels provided in that feature.

title: Mutex lock has possibility to fail at runtime (returning status flag)
body:
### Description

SHA for mbed-os: 30e39eeb10b2e0961068748651f001fe008b374a (currently latest master)

The Mutex method lock has possibility to fail at runtime. This is not acceptable as it might lead to unpredictable behavior and inconsistent system status if the application layer is not taking care about handling Mutex.lock() return values.

Refers to code:

title: RTC tests should start from year 2000+
body:
### Description

While running RTC tests on a new platform that is coming, we realized that certain RTC tests are causing problems because are expecting the MCU to handle old years correctly, for example, 1970.

See:
https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/master/TESTS/mbed_hal/rtc_time_conv/main.cpp
https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/master/TESTS/mbed_hal/rtc_time/main.cpp#L58

These dates are not supported in all MCUs. They are not applicable anymore given we are in 2018.

This enhancement/bug fix request is to relax RTC tests to start from the year 2000 onwards.

title: Nordic BLE: Allow configuration of softdevice parameters
body:
## Description

Allow configuration (via defines) of some of the key settings for the nordic softdevice.
* CENTRAL_LINK_COUNT
* PERIPHERAL_LINK_COUNT
* gatts_enable_params.attr_tab_size
* common_enable_params.vs_uuid_count
* gatts_enable_params.service_changed

These settings control the range of functionality enabled in the softdevice as well as ram consumption.
In particular, reducing these values is critical to enable usage of 16K nrf51 devices.

The defaults have not been changed so this should not effect existing users.

The values can be adjusted on a per-project basis by target_overrides in `mbed_app.json`, eg:
``` json
{
    "target_overrides": {
        "*": {
            "nordic-ble.central_link_count": 0,
            "nordic-ble.peripheral_link_count": 1,
            "nordic-ble.gatt_attr_tab_size": "0x4A0",
            "nordic-ble.uuid_table_max_entries": 2,
            "nordic-ble.is_srvc_changed_charact_present": 1
        },
}
```

Note: There are a couple of minor edits to the logging lines in `mbed-os/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_NRF5/TARGET_SDK11/softdevice/common/softdevice_handler/softdevice_handler.c`

These edits were not necessary in any later versions of the SDK.

## Status

**READY**

## Migrations

There should be no required changes to end user code.

## Related PRs

This is a cleaned up re-submission of #5980

## Steps to test or reproduce

Changing the target config values above in defines/config should result in a change of ram requirements.

When adjusting settings it is useful to enable `target.nrf_enable_logging` as shown above.  You will then get a printout on the mbed stdout serial port during softdevice configuration as such: 
```
sd_ble_enable: RAM START at 0x20002ef8
sd_ble_enable: RAM start should be adjusted to 0x20001f18
RAM size should be adjusted to 0x60e8
```

If the START value is lower than the RAM ORIGIN in the current linker file, the linker file can be copied into your project and edited to set the RAM ORIGIN and LENGTH to the printed values.
The mbed compile command can then have the linker arg set to your local linker file.

Target: MCU_NRF52832

I implemented a minimal `SecurityManager::EventHandler` that looks like this:

```
class SecurityManagerEventHandler: public SecurityManager::EventHandler {

	}
```

…and applied it like this:

```
	SecurityManagerEventHandler smeh;

```

…but all pairing requests are accepted. I poked at the code, and it looks like `GenericSecurityManager::on_pairing_request()` is only called on `TARGET_CORDIO`.

Assert traces are not shown when assert expression and/or filename is long
body:
### Description
<!-- 
    Required
    Add detailed description of what you are reporting.
    Good example: https://os.mbed.com/docs/latest/reference/workflow.html
    Things to consider sharing:
    - What target does this relate to?

    - What tools (name + version - is it mbed-cli, online compiler or IDE) are you using?
    - What is the SHA of Mbed OS (git log -n1 --oneline)?
    - Steps to reproduce. (Did you publish code or a test case that exhibits the problem?)
-->
**Target:** K64F (actually the used target does not matter)
**Toolchain:** GCC_ARM
**mbed-os version:** master (11901f115b0b81f875987cb9598dfbf0d57183c7)

If the expression and/or filename of MBED_ASSERT is too long, the assert trace print does not show up or it partially shown.

This is because the maximum length for print
 `mbed_error_printf("mbed assertation failed: %s, file: %s, line %d \n", expr, file, line);` 
is only 128 characters as defined in `mbed_error_vfprintf ` as `ERROR_BUF_SIZE`.

In our case the problem is mainly with the file name as the print includes the file name with full path and therefore the trace line can easily reach the 128 character limit.

title: STM32L0 EventQueue LPTIMER
body:
### Description
<!-- 
    Required
    Add detailed description of what you are reporting.
    Good example: https://os.mbed.com/docs/latest/reference/workflow.html
    Things to consider sharing:
    - What target does this relate to?
    - What toolchain (name + version) are you using?
    - What tools (name + version - is it mbed-cli, online compiler or IDE) are you using?
    - What is the SHA of Mbed OS (git log -n1 --oneline)?
    - Steps to reproduce. (Did you publish code or a test case that exhibits the problem?)
-->
**Target**
Custom **stm32l071** target based on the existing stm32l072 target

**Tools**
Keil uVision

**Mbed OS Version**
ARMmbed/mbed-os@c8d72c5

I have a problem where the the EventQueue stops firing timed events after approximately 71 minutes.

I suspect this has something to do with a 32-bit integer somewhere used to store the microsecond time which would mean it would reach about 71.58 minutes before overflowing.

Using the following code:

```c++
#include "mbed.h"
#include "events/EventQueue.h"

using namespace events;

DigitalOut led1(LED1, 1);

static EventQueue ev_queue(20 * EVENTS_EVENT_SIZE);

static void toggleLed() {
	led1 = !led1;
}

int main() 
{	
	ev_queue.call_every(5000, toggleLed);
	ev_queue.dispatch_forever();
	return 0;
}
```

With **MBED_CONF_EVENTS_USE_LOWPOWER_TIMER_TICKER** set to **1** and RTOS excluded in **.mbedignore**.

The issue has previously been discussed here: 
https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os-example-lorawan/issues/65

title: STM32F4 - I2C slave bug
body:
### Description
Type: Bug
- Related issue: `#abc`
- Priority: Minor

---------------------------------------------------------------
## Bug

**Target**
stm32f4

**Toolchain:**
IAR

**Toolchain version:**

**mbed-cli version:** 
(`mbed --version`)

**mbed-os sha:**
(`git log -n1 --oneline`)

I am using my stm32f4 microcontroller as an i2c slave for the first time.
At the begining, I used the example of i2c slave from I2CSlave.h.
The I2C master did not recieve the message sent by the i2c slave, so I used my scope to see the clk and data.
I noticed that the slave (my microcontroller stm32f4) is pulling down the clk when he recieves a read massage.
Looking at the datasheet and the registers made I saw that the NOSTRETCH register is disabled as defualt in i2c_frequency() at i2c_api.c
Changing the register in the fuction to enable solved my problem.
I would like to know why isn't there an api for the register and why is it disabled as default?

title: tools: Remove long-deprecated singletest.py
body:
### Description

The `mbed test` subcommand, based on greentea and htrun, replaced the
prototype of itself in this repo, named singletest.py. This PR removes
this long-replaced prototype, and all associated functionality.

This needs to happen, because it removes a large disincentive to improving
the test system: editing tools/test_api.py. This file has been very 
difficult to edit before as it's mostly noise; before this PR, `test_api`
contained both the singletest.py test runner implementation (replaced by 
htrun) and the test discovery and build implementation.

title: BLE addressType in AdvertisementCallbackParams_t, ConnectionCallbackParams_t and DisconnectionCallbackParams_t is inconsistent
body:
### Description
- Type: Question
- Priority: Minor

I have some BLE code in which my `Gap::CENTRAL` device looks for nearby devices and connects to them to read their characteristics.  In my advertisement callback, when I call `connect()` on a device, I use the `peerAddr` and `addressType` that I was given in `AdvertisementCallbackParams_t` (which is always `RANDOM_STATIC (1)`).  However, for _some_ (but not all) BLE peer devices, when my connection callback is called, the `peerAddrType` given to me in `ConnectionCallbackParams_t` changes: it becomes `RANDOM_PRIVATE_RESOLVABLE (3)` instead.  Is this meant to happen?  An example:

```
Added BLE device 48:c2:7c:2e:d1:d1, (address type RANDOM_STATIC) to list.
BLE device 48:c2:7c:2e:d1:d1 is visible.
  Advertising payload type 0x01 (FLAGS) (1 byte(s)): 0x1a.
  ...and discoverable, attempting to connect to it (address type RANDOM_STATIC), connect() successfully issued.
BLE device 48:c2:7c:2e:d1:d1 (address type RANDOM_PRIVATE_RESOLVABLE) is now connected (handle 0).
```
I'm asking because I keep a record of the devices along with their addresses and their address types, so a change of address type means I don't find the device in my list.  I could, of course, ignore the address type (if it is going to change like this): would that be the correct thing to do?

My code is [attached](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/files/1974492/main.cpp.txt) if it helps.

title: Support configuring stack size in RTOS-less build
body:
### Description
- Type: Enhancement
- Priority: Major

**mbed-os sha:**
mbed-os-5.8.3

I am evaluating Mbed Cloud 1.3.1 on **NUMAKER_PFM_M487**/**GCC_ARM**. In [mbed-bootloader](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-bootloader), it is built with RTOS disabled. With stack size hard-coded to 0x800 in linker script file, I meet stack overflow on `printf()` call. For RTOS enabled, I can change main thread's stack size through `mbed_app.json` (`MBED_CONF_APP_MAIN_STACK_SIZE`). But for RTOS disabled, it seems there's no way except modifying linker script file.

title: nRF5x BLE SecurityManager Implementation
body:
@marcuschangarm 

Target: **MCU_NRF52832**
**I'm using Softdevice S132**

I'm trying to port the ANCS client example that was made a few years ago with an older version of mbed. This example appears to be made when the BLE API wasn't filled out all the way. Link here:

https://github.com/ARMmbed/ble-ancs-client

I have the application running, but the device won't pair with the iPhone I've been testing with. It appears that encryption is never being established so the app can't get to actually subscribing to the ANCS. The return value of ble.securityManager().init() is "BLE_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED".

In my debugger it appears to be calling the base class SecurityManager::init() method (and thus returns that is hasn't been implemented). Not sure why it's not calling the subclass init method?

https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/e43d21d4ef6025e94e4567961cb87ed2f0474a26/features/FEATURE_BLE/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_NRF5x/source/nRF5xSecurityManager.h#L29-L36
